title.narrative: Programme d'Appui à la Promotion d'Emploi dans le Secteur Privé

description.narrative:
The overall objective of the program is to increase economic growth, reduce poverty and create employment opportunities in Mali through private sector support. The programme consists of three components: 1) strengthened development of policy, coordination and monitoring, 2) development of the private sector at the regional level in the regions of Mopti and Segou, and 3) improved access to financial services, which works to promote a national programmatic approach towards micro credits. The three components work to strengthen the coherence between employment creation and the private sector, based on local development potential in the regions of Mopti and Segou. All three components focus particularly on women and youth inclusion and employment. The programme was extended through 2013 due to the suspension of Danish development assistance in 2012.
A further extension into 2015 with activities targeting the northern regions of Gao and Timbuktu, which were not part of the original programme has been approved, and contracted to the Danish Refugee Council. The activities will target the rehabilitation of means of production lost during the crisis, or new means of production in order to promote employment in the region.
